did.unittitle: Preliminary Guide to the Washington State University Horticulture and Landscape Architecture Records
did.abstract: Administrative reports, meeting minutes, and project proposals related to the WSU departments of Horticulture and Landscape Architecture.

bioghist.p: Three instructional horticulture greenhouses were built on Wilson Road in 1951, between what would become Ensminger Pavilion and the future site of Lighty Hall. The greenhouses were torn down in 2007, and the two-thirds acre site was designated as a Display Garden at the behest of University President V. Lane Rawlins and under the guidance of landscape architecture professor Phil Waite. Design and building of the garden began in 2008 and continued thereafter through class projects in various landscape architecture courses.

scopecontent.p: Primarily consists of meeting minute notes, memoranda, and correspondence ranging from 1970-1986. Also includes project proposals, reports on the development of policies related to the international programs, as well as correspondence related to the Potato Commission. Also consists of publications created by the WSU Horticulture Club.

arrangement.p: This is an unprocessed collection. Any arrangement reflects either a pre-existing order from the records' creators or previous custodians, or preliminary sorting performed by staff.

Items are filed into folders by subject matter and year. Also includes a numbering system, but the justification for such is unclear. Boxes 1 and 3 include faculty meeting minutes, reports related to policy development and project proposals. Box 2 includes publications related to the WSU Horticulture Club ranging from 1982-1986. Box 4 includes correspondence and reports on faculty conferences.

accessrestrict.p: This collection is open and available for research use.

prefercite.p: Preliminary Guide to the Washington State University Horticulture and Landscape Architecture Records, 1970-1986 (UA1991-27)
Manuscripts, Archives, and Special Collections, Washington State University Libraries, Pullman, WA.

acqinfo.p: This material was transferred to WSU Libraries' MASC by Bonnie Duss of Horticulture and Landscape Architecture on August 06, 1991 and retained as UA1991-27.

controlaccess.p: This collection is indexed under the following headings in the online catalog. Researchers desiring materials about related topics, persons, or places should search the catalog using these headings.
